In *[Nethack](/wiki/Nethack "Nethack")*, the dollar sign, **$**, refers to [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") (or zorkmids) and also serves various purposes:

- In the dungeon, $ represents a pile of gold pieces.
- Press [$]() to count the gold in your [purse](/wiki/Purse "Purse"); doing so in a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") additionally displays the debt or credit you have with its [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper"), and all relevant values are displayed instantaneously. In any case, the count for your purse is always the same as the one on the [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line"), and does not include any money which you hid in containers such as a [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag"). Checking your gold is a free action and will not increment the turn counter.
  - You can also press [$]() to select [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") while in your inventory for certain menus. [Menu controls](/wiki/Menu_controls "Menu controls") supported by [tty](/wiki/Tty "Tty") and [curses interfaces](/wiki/Curses_interface "Curses interface") allow you to press certain keys and toggle selection for all items in that particular item group - in practice, only gold ever uses the $ item group.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Variants](#Variants)

  - [1.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [1.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [1.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces a new monster class, [killer coins](/wiki/Killer_coins "Killer coins"), that uses the $ glyph:

- $ [pile of killer coins](/wiki/Pile_of_killer_coins "Pile of killer coins")
- $ [large pile of killer coins](/wiki/Large_pile_of_killer_coins "Large pile of killer coins")
- $ [huge pile of killer coins](/wiki/Huge_pile_of_killer_coins "Huge pile of killer coins")

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), using [$]() to check your gold also tells you how much gold you have stashed away in containers within your inventory.

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") introduces additional monsters to the killer coins monster class from SLASH'EM:

- $ [pile of copper coins](/index.php?title=Pile_of_copper_coins\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pile of copper coins (page does not exist)")
- $ [pile of silver coins](/index.php?title=Pile_of_silver_coins\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pile of silver coins (page does not exist)")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

$

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In Nethack, the dollar sign, $, refers to gold (or zorkmids) and also serves various purposes:

  • In the dungeon, $ represents a pile of gold pieces.
  • Press $ to count the gold in your purse; doing so in a shop additionally displays the debt or credit you have with its shopkeeper, and all relevant values are displayed instantaneously. In any case, the count for your purse is always the same as the one on the status line, and does not include any money which you hid in containers such as a bag. Checking your gold is a free action and will not increment the turn counter.
    • You can also press $ to select gold while in your inventory for certain menus. Menu controls supported by tty and curses interfaces allow you to press certain keys and toggle selection for all items in that particular item group - in practice, only gold ever uses the $ item group.

Contents

  • 1 Variants
    • 1.1 SLASH'EM
    • 1.2 UnNetHack
    • 1.3 SlashTHEM

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces a new monster class, killer coins, that uses the $ glyph:

  • $ pile of killer coins
  • $ large pile of killer coins
  • $ huge pile of killer coins

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, using $ to check your gold also tells you how much gold you have stashed away in containers within your inventory.

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM introduces additional monsters to the killer coins monster class from SLASH'EM:

  • $ pile of copper coins
  • $ pile of silver coins

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[Nethack]]'', the dollar sign, '''$''', refers to [[gold]] (or zorkmids) and also serves various purposes:

* In the dungeon, {{yellow|$}} represents a pile of gold pieces.
* Press {{kbd|$}} to count the gold in your [[purse]]; doing so in a [[shop]] additionally displays the debt or credit you have with its [[shopkeeper]], and all relevant values are displayed instantaneously. In any case, the count for your purse is always the same as the one on the [[status line]], and does not include any money which you hid in containers such as a [[bag]]. Checking your gold is a free action and will not increment the turn counter. 
** You can also press {{kbd|$}} to select [[gold]] while in your inventory for certain menus. [[Menu controls]] supported by [[tty]] and [[curses interface]]s allow you to press certain keys and toggle selection for all items in that particular item group - in practice, only gold ever uses the {{white|$}} item group.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] introduces a new monster class, [[killer coins]], that uses the {{white|$}} glyph:

* {{monsymlink|pile of killer coins}}
* {{monsymlink|large pile of killer coins}}
* {{monsymlink|huge pile of killer coins}}

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], using {{kbd|$}} to check your gold also tells you how much gold you have stashed away in containers within your inventory.

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] introduces additional monsters to the killer coins monster class from SLASH'EM:

* {{brown|$}} [[pile of copper coins]]
* {{black|$}} [[pile of silver coins]]
{{nethack-367}}
